page.title: 03UNITED REFORMED CHURCH
page.content: The {United Reformed Church}was built in {1720}and extensively rebuilt in { {1862-3.}Formerly the{Methodist Church} with a resident vicar. The church is now looked after by voluntary lay preachers and the {Old Manse}where the vicar used to live was sold in 1978. There has been a great revival in attendance at the church recently owing to the enthusiasm of a few of its members. In {1979} the ceiling was lowered and a community room was built on the first floor which was created. Many other{amienities}were added, including a kitchen and toilets, which enabled a much greater range of activities to take place there with an emphasis on encouraging the attendance of children. There are now meetings there most days of the week with up to{60 adults and as many children attending weekly.
